derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense ('person) marked with a blemish or deformity'): from Latin stigma, stigmat- + -ic

means.word_mean: 1. a person whose body is marked by religious stigmata (such as marks resembling the wounds of the crucified Christ)
1. pertaining to or resembling of having stigmata
2. pertaining to a lens or lens system free of astigmatism (able to form point images)

auth_sentence.content: It has been reported that he carried a vial of blood that came from a stigmatic priest he had met.
